For the Peaks walk we were lucky in that we started in  lovely sunshine which made for great views, although it was harder than the Fanal walk, especially as most is on stone paths which I found quite hard on my feet.  (I am glad that I warmed up by walking from Lido to Monte and back via central Funchal as a warm up a few days earlier).  
A stick was helpful as was my headtorch.
The guides on both were interesting, although having done quite a number of walks I should know most of the interesting facts by now!
Coffee was very good value at the start and end of the Fanal walk, although the difficulty in getting the coffee up to Pico Ruivo did seem to be reflected in the price, double that of the others.   Walkers should be aware that the loos on the Peaks walk cost €0.50.
Overall they were really enjoyable walks.
reviews/4/title: Fanal enjoyable, the peaks harder, but amazing views
reviews/5/text: We booked and paid for the Kings Levada Walk. We were informed that the walk would start from Santana, however, no hotel pick up time was given. We called the office and were told that the walk had been closed 7 months ago - but pick up would be at 8:30am.  Pick up was on time, however we were taken to a different walk near Ponta Do Sol. It was a great walk following the old and new Levada. The guide was very informative  and there was just a small group of walkers, 9 in total. If the organisation had been as good as the guide, we would have given a full 5 star rating.
reviews/5/title: Not what we ordered - but a fantastic day anyway!
reviews/6/text: We had two level short walks as my wife is still recovering from breaking her ankle a last year. So long day walks with steps and slopes not considered. we signed up through T,he Residency as they recommended Madeira Explorers as they had passed the Covid19 tests. The two guides were excellent, fun, informative and at least tri-lingual. The drivers were sensible and professional- something 23 years ago before the building of the motorways and tunnels could not be said -and we have walked many many paths on the island. Tow great days.
reviews/7/text: Very pleasant walk on a cloudy day. Our guide Miguel was very informative about the Levada and plants although sometimes he tended to start talking before the back of the group arrived. I’d recommend good shoes , not walking sandals, as the path is very uneven in places. It is also narrow with steep drops so unsuitable for children or the less mobile. A lovely walk.
reviews/8/text: We had a most enjoyable levada walk with the brilliant Louisa as our well experienced guide who gave lots of interesting information. A short refreshment break was enjoyed by us all.
reviews/9/text: Perfect hiking experience with spectacular views and breathtaking paths and tunnels made it unique enough to be one of the best things to do in Funchal.
reviews/10/text:
This is a well-organised and professional group.  The website is clear and the e-mail communication for booking and for organising the pick-up was very good.

We chose the Rabaçal / Risco / 25 Fontes walk as it looked like the most interesting route.

We were picked up at exactly the planned time and there were eight people in our minibus.  There was a stop part-way for last-minute lunch shopping (and WCs) but we were pleased to have been to a supermarket in Funchal the day before.

The total number of people on the walk that Thursday was over 30 and so we were split up into two groups with separate guides.  Our guide (Marguerita) was fluent in both English and German, enough to be able to joke in both languages.  She shared loads of interesting information throughout the walk.

It was bright and dry in Funchal, but in the mountains it was heavy rain all day.  In some sections you do have to walk through shallow water.  If doing it again we would wear proper walking boots rather than our lighter walking shoes.

Torches were provided for the section in the 800-metre tunnel.

We felt that it was slightly expensive and that it could have been easier to pay by card (we had to be dropped off at the office where the people didn't seem to be expecting us).
reviews/10/title: Good way of seeing the mountains and levadas from the hotel areas
reviews/11/text:
We booked the 25 waterfalls levada walk at Rabacal with Sunny tours and were very impressed with Madeira Explorers,who operated the tour. The pick up was on time, the guide was excellent and his knowledge of the flora and fauna was outstanding. The walk was done at a reasonable pace although one part was particularly hilly due to a rockfall causing a diversion.

A very enjoyable day out.
reviews/11/title: Great Levada Walk With Madeira Explorers
reviews/12/text: I did a "WIND LAGOON - LEVADA DO ALECRIM" walk and it was really fantastic! We were lucky enough to have an excellent bus driver Tony and a great guide Miguel. Miguel provided us with lots of interesting information and cared for our safety and a nice, relaxed atmosphere. The walk itself passed through varied terrain and was a bit demanding at times, but the beautiful views were absolutely worth some effort. I highly recommend!
reviews/13/text: This levada was uneventful, views were not special in any way. Comments and explanations provindes by the guide were also rare and trivial.
reviews/14/text: All you need for your Levada Walk experience in Madeira, professional guides, confortable vans, the best prices!
reviews/14/title: The best tours in the island
reviews/15/text: We did Vale da Cerra D'Água. It nice and easy walk. Our guide Margarita was wonderful and informative guide.
reviews/16/text: We joined the 11km Fanal walk which was listed as difficult. A thoroughly enjoyable day in a group of 18 walkers of different nationalities despite the poor weather - everything from fog, mist, cloud and rain! A fun and informative guide.
reviews/16/title: Great guided walk in interesting company.
reviews/17/text: simply impeccable service! The best tour guides, spotless vans, and the most friendly drivers! Good Job Igor
reviews/17/title: The Best Tour company in Madeira
reviews/18/text: We took these two walking tours and both times we were amazed with the views! Our guides gave us interesting facts on the way and made it  very pleasant experience:) the walk on 3 highest peaks requires good physical condition as it is quite demanding. If you don't feel comfortable walking on your own and want to learn a bit more about your surroundings we definitely recommend Madeira Explorers. Moreover, for the 3 peaks you need someone to pick you up on the other side as it is too tiring to go back!
reviews/19/text: Of course, the company is it's people and the experience depend on the tour guide, who will accompany you. We were lucky to be guided by Filip (or "Marko in the case if something would go wrong") and we got the most positive impressions from our tour to Rabacal/Risco and 25 fontes. Filip was caring, available at any time, he waited for those who was not so fast as the rest and told a lot of information. We did another hiking route Pico Areiro/Ruivo with another guide. The two attractions were very different. The hike in mountains was more difficult, but provided also a lot of magnificent views. The guides provided us with safety instructions and torches needed to pass dark tunnels. Both times the minibus arrived perfectly in time. The drivers were very professional and it I felt safe while driving with Madeira Explorers. I definitely would advise this company.
subcategory_ranking: #14 of 446 things to do in Madeira
tags/urgency_tag/tag_text: Tours from Madeira Explorers tend to sell out - travelers recommend booking in advance!

address: Rabacal, Madeira 6160-206 Portugal
name: Levada do Alecrim
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Wood levada levada
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: "Levada do Rosemary"
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Private Transfer to Levada do Alecrim - Rosemary Levada (easy)
offer_group/offer_list/3/title: Private Guided Walk Levada Alecrim
offer_group/offer_list/4/title: Madeira Lakes - Levada do Alecrim
ranking: #93 of 446 things to do in Madeira
ranking_subcategory: #93 of 446 things to do in Madeira
reviews/0/text: Magical experience! You can combine a few hikes with this one as there are several in the same area. No need to pay exorbitant prices for a guide as the trail is easy enough to follow!
reviews/1/text:
1. Walk ‘Alecrim’ because it’s less crowded than ‘Risco’ and ‘25 Fontes’, both starting at the same parking lot. ‘Alecrim’ is as beautiful and interesting as the two others, and the waterfall in the end is a little more spectacular.
2. ‘Alecrim’ is 6,8 km - out + back - and takes about 2 hours to walk in moderate pace, shooting a lot of pictures along the track.
3. ‘Alecrim’ is considered one of the easiest levadas - children and elderly people can do it without problems.
4. Wear trainers or walking shoes. Sticks are not needed.
5. Don’t be afraid of the sun - you walk in the shade of trees all the way.
6. Consider bringing bathing suit and towel if you feel like taking a shower in the (pretty cold) waterfall.
7. START EARLY, 9 AM or earlier! We started out at 9.15, there were only 5 cars at the parking lot. 1 hour later, on our way back from the waterfall, we met 60-70 people heading for the waterfall, some of them walking in big groups - and every time you meet a person on the narrow path, you have to step aside and wait (pretty annoying). Back at the parking lot more than 100 cars were parked, and all the time more were arriving.
reviews/2/text: The Levada do Alecrim starts at the same point as the Levada do Risco and Levada das 25 Fontes. But it is less crowded and beatiful. Less crowded is a very good point to take into consideration, since the other two are almost imposible to do if not in the early morning (very early morning!). We started at 9:00 and made almost the entire way with people, which was great: you can ear the birds, the water, the silence of nature. In the end of the Levada you have two water falls and can take a bath if you want (very cold water). It is a relaxed walk because it it very flat, and you can take your kids if they can walk 7 kms.    It is also perfect for hot days.
reviews/2/title: Lovely flat levada, very easy to do and with lovely nature.
reviews/3/text: Incredible views over the clouds! The walk ends in an amazing and relaxing waterfall where you can swim.
reviews/3/title: Simple walk with an incredible ending
reviews/4/text: A comfortable couple hour walk with a very cold dip at the end. If you want and have time and strong legs do the levada do vento at the same time. This will add another hour or so to the journey.
reviews/5/text:
Very nice walk with only a few People. At the end a small waterfall. I recomed it. 
A the half of the path you can make a turn a go to the Rabacal House( start od levada des 25 fontes)
reviews/6/text:
I liked it because it was not that crowded.

It took is 50mins to get to the waterfall and 43 to come back, so a good walk but not too much

You have a lot of free parking at the beginning of the trail

You need good walking shoes because it has small rocks all the way and it can get uncomfortable if the sole is thin. Also when we were getting back it started raining and it can get a bit more slippery . 

Elevation is virtually not there except a flight of stairs. I saw a lot of people with small kids, dogs and elderly people being comfortable all the way.

You have 3 viewpoints where you see the alley, pretty spots. The walking via the levada you walk in a tunnel of woods, I find that the prettiest part. Then at the end there are 2 waterfalls. The second one, that you see from above,I find is the prettiest.

Oh, and the road there is a steep mountain road, need a good car, but this is all the island. You can get into the cloud too. Or you can stop and see the surrounding scenery .
reviews/7/text: Start 9-9.30, walk counterclockwise and you will avoid crowds. Walk to the source of the Levada do Alecrim which is a beautifull place, then retrace your steps to the descend to the Lagoa da Vento and then down to Rabacal. Here you can dwcide to either have a nice meal and head back or....which I would recommend , walk Levada 25 Fontes (at this time there will be crowds here but still well worth the effort) and the return back to Rabacal where you can take a ride up to the car park (3€). That took us 5hrs30min with lots of photos, rests, coffee and cakes and relaxing. If you want, you can do that all clockwise (avoiding crowds in 25Fontes) but that involves far more ascent. That was a GREAT DAY.
reviews/8/text: Was the best walk I ever made in this beautiful island, the waterfall was so amazing, so pure and clean, coming back for sure.
reviews/9/text: We combined this hike with the Risco and 25 Fontes levada walks.  Alecrim is MUCH less populated with hikers.  The parking location is the same location on road #110 at the top of the ridge that is used for the popular casa do Rabacal hikes.  Highly recommended!
reviews/10/text: Uma levada razoavelmente fácil e com alguns boas vistas, gostei do facto de ser próxima à das 25 Fontes e por essa razão ser bem sossegada dado que a maioria escolhe a 25 Fontes.
reviews/10/title: Provavelmente das melhores levadas que podem fazer, só pelo o simples facto de ser sossegada e simples de fazer.
reviews/11/text:
Levada super acessível, caminho é fácil e dos mais bonitos. Seguindo o curso da água encontra se paisagens lindas, o som da água. Chegamos a um cruzamento em que seguimos para o alecrim ( em frente) e voltando para trás, da para descer e ir ver a do vento, que para mim é das mais bonitas da madeira. 
A caminhada inicia se logo perto do estacionamento e não se encontra muitas pessoas mas é de fácil acesso.
reviews/12/text:
Foi a levada mais gira que fizemos embora seja muito repetitiva com a paisagem mais ou menos igual.
No entanto, é muito tranquilizadora e fácil de fazer pois sobe pouco
reviews/13/text:
Deze wandeling begint bij de iets hoger gelegen parkeerplaats.
In tegenstelling tot de wandeling naar 'Levada do Risco & 25 Fontes' daal je bij deze wanddeling niet af, je loopt gelijk langs de levada's af op een vlak pad.

Wij hebben deze hebben deze wandeling samen gecombineerd met 'Levada do Vento' wat heel goed te doen is. 

Je loopt dus eigenlijk door tot de waterval van Alecrim waar je trouwens op een warme dag een heerlijke frisse duik kan nemen.
Van daaruit kan je niet anders dan terug keren omdat hier ook het pad ophoud.

Bij de wegwijzer "Levado do Vento' daal je af naar beneden via de trappen, deze zal je ook weer omhoog moeten lopen om daarna de route te vervolgen naar Rabacal, waar je even lekker kan bijkomen bij het restaurantje. Je kan natuurlijk ook weer de trappen terug omhoog pakken, wat ik zelf niet zou advisere.

Mocht je geen zin meer hebben om de gehele wandeling vanaf het restaurant naar boven te lopen dan kan je daar tegen betaling een busje pakken die je weer naar boven brengt.

Wij zijn de weg zelf gewoon naar boven gelopen.
reviews/14/text:
Umas das levadas da Madeira mais acessíveis, ficando a cerca de 40 km do Funchal, junto a Calheta!
Levada com 6 km ida e volta, sempre, quase sempre em terreno plano, finalizando com bela queda de água!
Acessível a quase todos, a partir dos 5 a 6 anos de idade, pois existe algumas zonas de trilhos mtos estreitos e grandes declives.
Fácil encontrar o acesso à Levada, podendo utilizar o Google maps para a localizarem! 
Uma excelente experiência para 2 a 3 horas, vale a pena!
reviews/15/text: Eine ruhige, nicht viel begangene Levada. Wer das Getümmel bei Rabacal meiden will, findet hier eine tolle Alternative. An einigen Stellen schöne Ausblicke, mystische Bäume und Sträucher. Am Ende beglückt uns ein See und Wasserfälle. Auf dem gleichen Weg zurück, ca. 2.5 Std.
reviews/16/text:
Diese Levada-Wanderung (Länge je Strecke ca. 3,5 km) führt vom Parkplatz weg in Richtung Schranke. Kurz darauf unbedingt rechts halten und an der dort beginnenden Levada ansetzen. Zunächst führt diese Levada kein Wasser. Aber nach 600-900 m kommt man an einen ersten kleinen Bachlauf mit Wasser und ab da führt die Levada Wasser und es läuft sich aufgrund der Bodens auch leichter.
Zwischendurch kommt man an eine Treppe, die besser gesichert sein sollte.
Kurz vor Ende der Wanderung hört man Wasserrauschen. Plötzlich steht man vor einem Bachlauf mit vorgeschaltetem Wasserfall, der einfach nur schön ist.
reviews/17/text: Deze wandeling vanaf de parkeerplaats Rabacal is erg rustig. Het is een mooie, vlakke tocht (met 1 trap zonder leuning)  en aan het einde een mooie waterval waar je heerlijk op de stenen je lunch kunt eten. Waar de rest van de toeristen naar de 25 Fontes of de Risco waterval lopen, kun je hier lekker genieten zonder telkens tegenliggers te moeten passeren. Het is een korte wandeling, dus bijvoorbeeld goed te combineren met een rondrit over de hoogvlakte.
reviews/18/text: Vlakke wandeling naar best een leuk punt. Watervalletje. Probeer als je tijd en zin hebt ook naar beneden te lopen naar. Je wordt dan getrakteerd op een hoge waterval.
reviews/18/user/user_location/name: Krimpen aan den IJssel, The Netherlands
reviews/19/text: Se trata de un recorrido lineal de unos 3,4 km (otros tantos a la vuelta) que también se podría realizar de manera circular. El sendero nos lleva todo el camino teniendo a la derecha la levada y a la izquierda las espectaculares vistas del bosque de Laurisilva. El camino finaliza en una zona (Madre de la Levada do Alecrim) en la que existe una sucesión de pequeñas cascadas que convierten esa zona en espectacular. El retorno lo puedes hacer por el mismo camino o, a 900 metros de las cascadas tomar un camino descendente que nos lleva a la Lagoa do Vento. Desde la Lagoa tomaremos después el camino que lleva a la Casa Do Rabaçal.
subcategory_ranking: #93 of 446 things to do in Madeira

address: Foz da Ribeira da Boaventura, Santa Cruz, Madeira 9100-115 Portugal
animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.
description: ATTRACTION | EVENTS | SLOW RIVER |WATER SLIDES |EVENTS | BIRDS SHOW OPEN : 10h - 18h - 7/7 PRICES : - ADULTS 8€ - CHILDRENS 5€ - FAMILY 20€ - FREEPASS 100€
name: Aquaparque Madeira
ranking: #149 of 446 things to do in Madeira
ranking_subcategory: #149 of 446 things to do in Madeira
reviews/0/text: This park is advertised as being open. Drove 45 mins to get there to find it closed with dirty green water. Such a shame. Stop advertising it as being open- it is most definitely closed.
reviews/1/text: Hi I had read the reviews before we went and anticipated it to be a short easy day. It was far better than I expected. It’s true there are few rides but it is so easy as the queues are fast, staff are easy going and place is so clean. They had a bird demonstration session and that was a lovely distraction and gave a break from the running from slide to slide and pool to pool. 50euros for 2+3 kids and was well worth it as sn easy day out
reviews/2/text: Easy half day away from the hotel (which was 5 mins in a taxi away) and a chance for my 7 year old to let off some steam. Mainly attended by locals, which was reflected in the really reasonable entry prices and cafe.
reviews/3/text: Spent a good few hours of a day here, 3 adults, 2 15 yo, 11yo, 8yo. The slides are good, although there arent many,but for the price it's fair. The animals were great, and the €10 for the photo was more than reasonable I thought. Drinks and food were well priced and the choice was wide for things to buy. Toilets were clean and well maintained and the safety staff were good.
reviews/4/text:
It is a very small water park but great for younger children for an afternoon. There are lots of little slides which were perfect for our 5 year old. The pools were very cold though and the main small pool is a little tired. A major negative was that there were lots of paint chips in this pool, let alone leaves etc, which weren't nice to walk/ swim in. The lazy river didn't have much of a current and there weren't enough rubber rings so people had to wait a long time for people to finish with them. The bigger slides were good and would keep older kids and adults occupied! More shade is needed so the young kids can get out of the sun for a while but it's too windy for parasols. The animal show was ok (not sure about parrots riding bikes!) but the flights of the larger birds of prey were impressive. Felt like the small cages and baskets the animals were in was concerning. The show was all in Portuguese so we would have liked a bit of translation but appreciate its a Portuguese island! 
Cafe was very reasonably priced with lots of family friendly food. Little one loved 'meeting' 'Mickey' and 'Minnie' (or as we said Miguel and Maria Mouse!). Photos quite pricey as same price as an adult entry
reviews/4/title: Good for younger children but needs a refresh
reviews/5/text:
Visited August 2021.  Prices are 10€ adults and 7€ for children.  Fairly small aqua park, but enough to keep the family amused for an afternoon.   Slides of varying speeds.  

Easily reached by bus from Funchal.  Google told us we’d have to walk from Santa Cruz, but the bus actually stops outside.  Take the SAM bus from the promenade in Funchal.
reviews/6/text:
Prices advertised on here are incorrect. A
There is no family package. Adults pay €10 and children from 5-12 pay €7. I did raise this matter with management who informed me that new management have taken over and prices have gone up. A bit of a rip off if you ask me!
reviews/7/text: The kids had so much of fun - we had to go on two days! Very short lines. Fun slides for all ages.  Sanitizer stations everywhere.  The bird shows was average.  The food at the cafe was acceptable but a little more expensive than expected.
reviews/8/text: The water park is only small but adequate, not over crowded and only €10 adult €7 a child. you can take picnics and drinks so no need to pay the cafe prices which were also reasonable, unlike most other waterparks. The place was very clean and covid friendly with sanitizer stations around the park. All in all a nice afternoon. Highly recommended if you want a few hours chilling.
reviews/9/text: A little water park with a great slide and a little calm river, a lot of fun and not so many people so you don't need to wait in line, Tom.
reviews/10/text:
We went to the park on August with our grandparents, cousins and his family. Firstly they don’t do family tickets for my cousin and his wife with the two kids, they all have to pay separately. In addition our grandparents have to pay full price even so clearly they weren’t going to swim and only wanted to spend a day out with the family. There are websites online which give information about family tickets and discount prices for over 65 which in reception immediately deny saying that is not true or are out of date.

In general the facilities are ok but it is an average park which is very overpriced for Madeira standards. We did the most of it and it was just ok as we travelled with my cousin’s children but if you don’t have children I’d avoid it as it will get boring very quickly.
reviews/10/title: Average overpriced water park with misleading information online
reviews/11/text:
We went in a group ranging from 1 year to 60 something years old and I think everyone had a good time.  It isn't the biggest waterpark in the world but there is a good variety of things from little slides for toddlers to exciting flumes for teenage/adults.

Everything was spotlessly clean and well run, had absolutely no complaints while we were there
reviews/12/text: Went at 10am got sun loungers and parasol and spent a lovely day there, there was quite a bit of wind but as weather was hot was actually lovely. Water is very cold but have to admit you get used to it pretty quick. There is not much shade so would definitely recommend getting a parasol.
reviews/13/text: Good place for the last day in Madeira when you have night flight back home and you need to leave the room before midday.
reviews/13/title: If you have a teenage child that is a place where he would love to go in hot day
reviews/14/text:
Freezing cold water - apparently it’s mountain mountain - unbearable cold for me and my 2 year old but my 4 year didn’t mind it for a short time. We won’t go again for this reason, with the wind it was unpleasant.
32euro taxi from the pesana promenade hotel one way. Thankfully the taxi driver suggested he came back for us later in the day as there weren’t any when we came out.
reviews/15/text: Reasonable entry prices, good flumes and rides for kids and the cafe was not expensive and the food was good.
reviews/15/title: not so keen on the animal shows but a good day out.
reviews/16/text:
On the negative this water park has very little shade and queues for food and rides can be long.  The changing rooms and toilets are fairly rudimentary.

On the positive, the rides are great, with a good variety for different levels.  There are three quite challenging rides: high, twisty, fast etc.  There are two helter-skelter type rides for medium levels. And there are two for very young kids, including a rubber-ring floating ride.  And there are a couple of paddling pools.  Food itself when you get it (try not to eat at peak times) is ok - some interesting varieties of hot dogs for example! Again great for kids!
reviews/17/text: What a great place.This was our 3rd time to Maderia. We always pass the park on the way to and from the airport.We said we must go there. Our boys are 5 and 8 years and loved it. The youngest even went on the big the slide.Which was pretty fast. Very well managed life guards do a great job. There was a lot of school trips going on while we were there.So they had there work cut out. We arrived when it opened at 10am and stayed till 3pm About the right amount of time.We ate there,food was reasonably priced. Eat earlier rather than later to avoid the rush. We hired sun loungers and umbrella for a 5€ and 3€ each. Didn’t really use them. A bit windy for umbrella.A nice surprise was the parrots and lizard on entry and a photo with them. Boys loved it. No obligation to buy on your way out. A bit pricy for each photo. But your creating memories so what the heck. Definitely recommend.
reviews/18/text:
This is a lovely place to come with the family and generally the pool
area is good especially for the kids... however beware that the service at the fast food cafe ‘burgers and chips’ it’s not ‘fast’ but extremely
‘Slow’ and when it arrived it was cold which made me really angry after waiting 40minutes for 3 burgers and chips! Cafe staff are rude as they seemed overworked and the boss is on the phone in the background talking casually on he phone not giving a sh**!  There is also no toilet seats on any of the toilets which is extremely poor considering you pay to get in and cold showers. This place could be amazing if there was good managers in place with a bit of experience and training. I am
Portuguese myself and don’t understand why us Portuguese settle for poor service especially after so many people in Madeira are struggling to find jobs ... you would think everyone would try and give the best customer service you could 
- but no.. all you get is arrogance!
reviews/18/title: Do not eat at this place! Long wait and poor sevice
reviews/19/text:
Our boys aged 11 & 8 love this park which keeps them amused all day on the slides, is a pool and a lazy river.
The slides appear to have been repainted/covered & more payment tills in the cafe which serves plenty to eat and/or drink 👍.
Sun beds were a little expensive in our opinion at €3 each and we were not able to hire a parasol as it was a little too windy the day we visited.
Weather was colder than Funchal in the morning but brightened up in the day so worth checking the weather out before visiting as it does vary across the island.
Photos taken by the photographer cost €10 each which we felt was expensive despite some money going towards an animal sanctuary.
The parrot show was very entertaining 👏
Taxi from Funchal was £60 for 6 of us, there was/is also the option of buses. Entrance was €8 for adults and €5 for kids which we think is good value.
I am sure we will be returning next year.
subcategory_ranking: #149 of 446 things to do in Madeira
tags/animal_welfare_tag/msg_body: Click below for expert advice on animal welfare in tourism.

address: Estrada Simao Goncalves da Camara 37, Calheta, Madeira 9370-139 Portugal
name: Museu de Arte Contemporanea da Madeira
ranking: #120 of 446 things to do in Madeira
ranking_subcategory: #120 of 446 things to do in Madeira
reviews/0/text: We walked up from the beach, arrived at lunchtime and it was closed, but while we waited we enjoyed the peace and quiet outside and the stunning views. Restaurant not open.  We also noticed the live webcam on the side of the building which you can find on YouTube - we'd looked at it a lot before visiting Calheta!  The gallery was only open on two floors as the exhibits were changing.  Most of the exhibits were quite depressing and the written labels on each didn't give enough information.  We found the lighting to be very old fashioned and certainly did not show off the artwork to its best, a big shame and this needs investment, in our opinion.
reviews/1/text:
What a fantastic building with stunning views of the surrounding area. Loved the roof area with plants and the use of stone. The interior was just as wonderful. Plenty of exhibition space and good lighting. 
However the “art” work on display was so mediocre and I could not believe that this was the best of Portuguese contemporary art. Nothing was inspiring, unique or thought provoking. The printed information from the exhibiting artist and curator was just a collection of words that meant very little. 
The gift shop was also uninspiring and certainly did not encourage you to buy. 
Found it strange that the gallery closed for lunch? Have never come across that before when visiting a national gallery. 
I would certainly recommend visiting the exterior and interior of the building but leave the visitor to make up their own mind when looking at the art work.
reviews/2/text: Receptionist not very helpful, only place on island asked for vaccine certificates that I had to walk back to car for, to be told it was closing in half hour for an hour's lunch!!!!!! left
reviews/3/text:
An absolutely stunning building in a wonderful position. Not only is it a great piece of design.but it has been beautifully built. 
It claims to be a home for the best of Portuguese art which is a big claim and hopefully it has a better exhibition than when we were there. 
It’s amazing that a gallery of this importance doesn’t appear to have a decent web site. We walked all the way up from Calhita only to be told we needed our proof of Covid unusually for a major art gallery  it closes for lunch. The cafe was closed. 
Despite the lacklustre exhibition it was still worth a visit just for the building. We hoped the bookshop would have info on the building and maybe some postcards but nothing.
reviews/3/title: Great building, shame about the art.
reviews/4/text: We visited the museum quite spontaneously and were quite impressed how professional and detail-oriented the setup was. We enjoyed this experience very much!
reviews/5/text: Loved the building and great views. Art was ok but no real big names or iconic exhibitions. Good cafe.
reviews/6/text:
The building is very contemporary and is a real statement on the top of the cliffs overlooking Calheta beach and marina.
There is an assortment of art on display including pen and ink, oils, photos, modern sculptures, iron works and paper art which are all interesting and diverse.
It’s only 4 euros to enter, 1 euro if a senior.
There is a restaurant which serves lunch or just a drink.
Great views from the top out to sea and along the coast.
Well worth a visit.
reviews/7/text:
Having missed visiting in previous visits we managed to visit the museum at last his year.  We were based in Funchal and hired a car for a few days.  Thus came with Sat Nav so it was easy to find the museum.  We parked just a few yards past the museum on the roadside.

The building itself is a great modern building which provides nice space for the art.  

The works are quite varied and modern, which we really enjoyed.

We were hoping to get a coffee there but the coffee shop was not open on the Sunday morning we visited. However having seen the great views from the museum to the seafront, we decided a trip down there would be a good place to end our trip to Calheta.
reviews/8/text: We walked up to the museum which was challenging but worth it. The art works were excellent and varied. It was really good to see modern art works from artists we were not familiar with. The building itself is striking and interesting, a perfect display space. The cafe unfortunately was limited but that was the only downside.
reviews/8/title: A jewel in the Calheta crown
reviews/9/text: We drove from Funchal to find a notice on the entrance apologising for the fact that the gallery was closed that afternoon, Friday 30 November, in preparation for a new exhibition - it was 11.30am!  We could see preparations in progress for what looked like a rather lavish lunch - humph!
reviews/10/text: I really liked how modern art is presented in this museum. people are nice and explain you things in an understandable way. I think it is a must visit place for museum lovers.
reviews/11/text:
...containing some beautiful exhibition spaces and affording lovely views.  However the contents are...to my eye...bland and uninspiring. Perhaps that is because of the quality of the work
Itself - after all, can an Island as small
as Madeira really have made much of a contribution to the conversation of Modern Art?  Or perhaps because no real curatorial context is given for the artworks apart from some elliptical and badly translated general headings. 

I was told by someone at the desk that there was no café. There was.

Nevertheless, I would visit for the building alone.
reviews/12/text: After a very steep half hour climb up to the Museum from the beach - unless you are extremely fit I suggest you take a taxi instead - it is an interesting building, well laid out with interesting artwork.  Lots of stairs but there is a lift on each floor.  Not air conditioned but is spacious so wasn’t too stifling.  Small bar/tea room nearby to catch your breath before the descent.  Great photo opportunities from the outside museum terraces.
reviews/12/title: Interesting Building & Art work - worth the steep climb !
reviews/13/text: Only 4 Euros to enter. Very nice gallery with some very interesting exhibits even though we are not modern art lovers.
reviews/13/title: Just the ticket for Modern Art Lovers
reviews/13/user/user_location/name: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
reviews/14/text: I great place we visited as a part of a tour with taxi. Its a perfect place to relax and make some pictures.
reviews/15/text: Modern art, mainly paintings from Portuguese artists and some 3D objects. Very large building with 2 stories.
reviews/16/text: The parking spaces were free as barriers were up but also parking by the entrance. Cost of entry is 4€ and the works are spread over three spacious floors with glimpses of the surroundings through slots. The rooms are themed and contain only Portuguese artwork. Some found engaging others less so and without more insight into the artists background difficult to appreciate. All in all a place to drop into and wonder at the architecture enjoy a snack in the excellent cafe and dip into the rich modern Portuguese art world.
reviews/16/title: A visit to this beautiful modern art museum
reviews/17/text:
We took bus to Calheta and needed to ask how to find Mudas Museum. Go along the beach pedestrian street and then turn the right and go up, and up and after a small church turn left and then just go up along very steep street. About 2 km. Take taxi! But, we wanted to walk and look around what kind of village Calheta is. It is pretty small, but it has one of the two Madeira Island sand beaches!
But, no singular sing or announcement about Museum, nothing! 
But the museum itself is worth to visit and get some information about Portuguese art today. Photos, all kind, were prohibited to be taken.

But the restaurant food at the museum is lousy, the dining room is modern and quite stylish, but the main thing - food - is not.
reviews/17/title: Contemporary Art Museum is good... if one can find it
reviews/18/text: After we tried several times during the last years and the museum was closed when we had been there (mostly December) this was the first time we had the chance to visit the collection. It is absolutely worth a visit - not only the stunning view and architecture but as well to get insights into portoguese art and its contemporary development.
reviews/18/title: fantastic architecture and a good experience
reviews/19/text:
The building itself is most impressive already. Very cool architecture. Going inside you won't believe the price. It's 4 EUR per person, 1 EUR for our 12-year-old only.
And then it's - well - art. Very different from "strange" to "let's put it in our house".
Even our junior said it was "ok" (that means a lot ;-)).
